clinical_study.brief_title: Family Heart Health Program: Randomized, Controlled Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Family Heart Health Program: Randomized, Controlled Trial

collaborator.agency: Heart and Stroke Foundation of Canada

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary outcomes of interest will include the modifiable components comprising the Framingham score (smoking status, systolic BP, total cholesterol, HDL- and LDL-cholesterol)
Use of risk reducing medications, use of health care resources, smoking status, leisure time exercise, dietary patterns, and body composition

intervention.intervention_name: 12-week risk reduction program, managed by a Heart Health Educator
intervention.description: The educator and participant will negotiate a personal plan for achieving the goals through lifestyle change (i.e. smoking cessation, increased exercise, improved nutrition) and, if necessary, pharmacotherapy coordinated by the participant's personal physician. Educational modules have been developed to address specific lifestyle issues including smoking cessation, healthy eating, exercise, and weight management, and will be provided to participants as required. A summary of the risk factor profile and personal plan will be incorporated into a report for the participant's personal physician as well. Participants will also receive telephone-based motivational counseling sessions for 12 weeks to address specific lifestyle issues.
